name: hexamethyldisilazane production, amination of chlorosilane | hexamethyldisilazane | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/5182/documentation

This dataset represents the chlorosilane amination to obtain hexamethyldisilazane and ammonium chloride, which are derived as co-products. The functional unit is 1 kg chlorosilane. The system includes the process with consumption of raw materials, energy, infrastructure, and land use, as well as the generation of emissions to air and water. It also includes transportation of the raw materials. Transient or unstable operations like starting-up or shutting-down, are not included, but the production during stable operation conditions. Storage and transportation of the final product are also not included. It is assumed that the manufacturing plants are located in an urban/industrial area and consequently the emissions are categorised as emanating in a high population density area. The emissions into water are assumed to be emitted into rivers. ;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From the reception of chlorosilane at the factory gate.

This activity ends with the chlorosilane amination. This activity includes materials, energy uses, infrastructure and emissions.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The inventory is modelled for the world..
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Chlorosilane amination is the most important process to produce hexamethyldisilazane. Many chlorosilanes react with ammonia to give not stable, simple silylamines SiNH2, but disubstitution products with the SiNHSi building block. The exothermic reaction can be carried out in solvents such as hexane, toluene, or isododecane, but is best performed in warm HMDS itself. The latter variant leads to the formation of coarse-grained ammonium chloride, which can be readily stirred and filtered and gives better turnover and yield. The suggestion has been made that the salt be separated by treatment with water. ;A continuous process for the production of HMDS consisting of the concurrent actions of continuously introducing predetermined quantities per time unit of trimethylchlorosilane and gaseous ammonia to form a mixture of HMDS and ammonium chloride in a first reactor while simultaneously subjecting said mixture to continuous high shear agitation, for a time period related to the volume of the reactor and the quantities of trimethylchlorosilane and ammonia introduced, to form a slurry; and simultaneously separating the ammonium chloride from said slurry to provide a solution principally comprising HMDS, while continuing to introduce a continuous flow of further quantities of trimethylchlorosilane and ammonia as the HMDS is removed. ;;Rösch, L., John, P., Reitmeier, R.: Silicon Compounds, Organic. Published online: 2000. In: Ullmann's Encyclopedia of Industrial Chemistry, Seventh Edition, 2004 Electronic Release (ed. Fiedler E., Grossmann G., Kersebohm D., Weiss G. and Witte C.). 7 th Electronic Release Edition. Wiley InterScience, New York, Online-Version under: http://www.mrw.interscience.wiley.com/emrw/9783527306732/home
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Energy consumptions and emissions are estimated. Infrastructure and transports are calculated with standard values.

exchanges.description:
Hexamethyldisilazane is a clear, colorless liquid that hydrolizes slowly upon exposure to water.
HMDS forms strong hydrogen bonds and is only weakly basic. Alkali and alkaline-earth metals form salts with it, e.g., LiN (SiMe3)2.
Hexamethyldisilazane is used as a catalyst in condensation reactions of heterocyclic compounds such as in the microwave synthesis of a derivative of xanthine.
It is also used as raw material to produce amidosilanes.
EcoSpold01Location=GLO

flow.name: Water
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/unspecified

exchanges.description: Estimation. As approximation the air emissions occurring from the purge vent, the distillation vent and fugitive emission sources were estimated to 0.2% of the raw material input.

flow.name: Ammonia
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/high population density

exchanges.description: Estimation. This value was approximated from the gases implied in the water treatment: the carbon contained in the removed chlorosilane is accounted as CO2 emissions to air.

flow.name: Carbon dioxide, fossil
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/high population density

exchanges.description: Estimation. The remaining amount of unreacted chlorosilane and ammonium (4.8 % of the input) is assumed to leave the production process with the waste water. Further it was assumed that this wastewater is treated in an internal wastewater plant. The nitrogen emitted to air (N2). The removal efficiency for chlorosilane is assumed with 90%. The remaining in the sewage sludge is neglected. The remaining chlorosilane is calculated as silicon and chloride emissions.

flow.name: Chloride
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to water/surface water

exchanges.description:
Stoichiometric calculation. As there was no data available for the chlorosilane amination, the values for the consumption of the raw materials are calculated with an assumed yield of 95 %

exchanges.description:
Estimation. This value was approximated with data from an large chemical plant site in Germany producing 2.05 Mt a-1 (intermediates included) of different chemicals. This value was used in this inventory as approximation for the cooling water consumption of the chlorosilane amination.

exchanges.description: Estimation. The remaining amount of unreacted chlorosilane and ammonium (4.8 % of the input) is assumed to leave the production process with the waste water. flow.name: Silicon
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to water/surface water

exchanges.description: Estimation. The remaining amount of unreacted chlorosilane and ammonium (4.8 % of the input) is assumed to leave the production process with the waste water. Further it was assumed that this wastewater is treated in an internal wastewater plant. For the ammonia within the waste water a removal efficiency of 50% was assumed. The nitrogen emitted to air (N2). The removal efficiency for chlorosilane is assumed with 90%. The remaining in the sewage sludge is neglected. The remaining chlorosilane is calculated as silicon and chloride emissions.

flow.name: Ammonium
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to water/surface water

exchanges.description:
Estimation. Those values were approximated with data from an large chemical plant site in Germany producing 2.05 Mt a-1 (intermediates included) of different chemicals. The values for the energy consumption per kg of product of this plant (3.2 MJ kg-1) were used as approximation for the energy consumption of the chlorosilane amination. This total energy demand contains a split of 50% natural gas, 38% electricity and 12% steam from external energy sources. For this inventory all energy used for heat or steam was assumed to be natural gas
EcoSpold01Location=RER
